name: BXD44 x B6.Cg-Tg(APPSwFlLon,PSEN1*M146L*L286V)6799Vas/Mmjax
description: Transgenic mice that retained the transgenes from the 5XFAD parent following the cross of 5XFAD strain and BXD44 strain, and thus display Alzheimer’s disease-like pathology

name: Vip<tm1(cre)Zjh>/J × B6.Cg-Gt(ROSA)26Sor<tm9(CAG-tdTomato)Hze>/J
description: Offspring from mice expressing Cre recombinase directed to Vip-expressing cells bred with mice containing loxP-flanked sequences. This offspring has vasoactive intestinal polypeptide (VIP) postive interneurons that express the fluorescent protein tdTomato.

name: B6.129-Nlgn3<tm1Sud>/J
description: These mice carry an R451C mutation in exon 7 of the gene. Mutant mice exhibit enhancements in inhibitory synaptic transmission as well as spacial learning and memory, but show deficits in social interaction. This mutant mouse strain may be useful in studies of the pathophysiology of autism.

name: F1: B6.Cg-Tg(APPSwFlLon,PSEN1*M146L*L286V)6799Vas/Mmjax X DBA/2J
description: Transgenic mice that retained the transgenes from the B6-5XFAD parent following the cross of B6-5XFAD strain  and DBA/2J strain, and thus display Alzheimer’s disease-like pathology

name: PV-iRES-Cre (C57BL/6J background)
description: A strain with Cre recombinase expression directed to cells expressing parvalbumin (PV).

name: Tg-GlyT-2GFP (C57BL/6 background)
description: GlyT-2GFP transgenic mice, which express green fluorescence protein in glycine transporter 2 positive cells

name: B6.FVB(Cg)-Tg(Drd2-cre)ER44Gsat/Mmucd x B6.Cg-Gt(ROSA)26Sor<tm9(CAG-tdTomato)Hze>/J
description: Offspring from mice expressing Cre recombinase directed to dopamine receptor 2-expressing cells bred with mice containing loxP-flanked sequences. This offspring has dopamine-receptor 2 postive cells that express the fluorescent protein tdTomato.

name: Tg-PV (C57BL/6J background)
description: A transgenic mouse strain expressing cell-type-specific fluorescent markers to target specific connections, here parvalbumin-expressing cells.

name: BAC-vGluT2/iCre (C57BL/6J background)
description: A strain with optimized Cre recombinase (iCre) with mutations within the BAC transgene. VGLUT2 is a vesicular glutamate transporter. iCre-mediated recombination results in deletion of the flanked sequence in VGLUT2 positive cells.

name: BXD68x B6.Cg-Tg(APPSwFlLon,PSEN1*M146L*L286V)6799Vas/Mmjax (WT)
description: Mice that lost the transgenes from the 5XFAD parent following the cross of 5XFAD strain and BXD68 strain, and thus display wild-type traits.

name: Tg-delta2-188-EGFP (Wistar background)
description: A transgenic strain produced by calcium phosphate transfection with N-terminal truncated gephyrin  polypeptide where amino acids 2–188 were removed (gephyrin (delta2-188)) fused to enhanced green fluorescent protein (EGFP).

name: C57BL/6J-Tg(Thy1-GCaMP6f)GP5.5Dkim/J
description:
These transgenic mice, made by the Genetically-Encoded Neuronal Indicator and Effector (GENIE) Project, express the green fluorescent calcium indicator, GCaMP6f, in subsets of excitatory neurons in the brain and possibly other cell types and tissues. The GCaMP6f indicator is an ultrasensitive detector of single neuronal action potentials and has fast response kinetics.
The transgene contains a mouse Thy1 promoter, GCaMP6f, woodchuck hepatitis virus posttranscriptional regulatory element (WPRE), and bovine growth hormone (bGH) polyadenylation sequence.

name: SST-Cre (C57BL/6J background)
description: Mice with this strain express Cre recombinase directed to somatostatin-expressing cells.

name: BXD100 x B6.Cg-Tg(APPSwFlLon,PSEN1*M146L*L286V)6799Vas/Mmjax
description: Transgenic mice that retained the transgenes from the 5XFAD parent following the cross of 5XFAD strain and BXD100 strain, and thus display Alzheimer’s disease-like pathology

name: B6.Cg-Tg(APPSwFlLon,PSEN1*M146L*L286V)6799Vas/Mmjax
description: 5XFAD transgenic mice rapidly recapitulate major features of Alzheimer's Disease amyloid pathology. They overexpress both mutant human amyloid beta (A4) precursor protein 695 (APP)) with the Swedish (K670N, M671L), Florida (I716V), and London (V717I) Familial Alzheimer's Disease (FAD) mutations and human PS1 harboring two FAD mutations, M146L and L286V.

name: Tg-Thy1-GFP-M (unknown background)
description: A transgenic mouse strain expressing GFP in Thy1-expressing cells.

name: CR-iRES-Cre (C57BL/6J background)
description: A strain with Cre recombinase expression directed to cells expressing calretinin (CR).

name: Chrna2-Cre (C57BL/6J background)
description: A strain with Cre recombinase expression directed to cells expressing nicotinic acetylcholine receptor alpha 2 subunit (Chrna2).

name: B6N.Cg-Sst<tm2.1(cre)Zjh>/J × B6.Cg-Gt(ROSA)26Sor<tm9(CAG-tdTomato)Hze>/J
description: Offspring from mice expressing Cre recombinase directed to somatostatin-expressing cells bred with mice containing loxP-flanked sequences. This offspring has somatostatin postive interneurons that express the fluorescent protein tdTomato.

name: Tg-Drd2-EGFP (Arc:Arc(S) background)
description: Drd2-EGFP mice were originally generated at the Gene Expression Nervous System Atlas (GENSAT) program at the Rockefeller University, New York,USA, and were bred on an outbred Arc:Arc(S) Swiss background at the Florey Institute of Neuroscienceand Mental Health, Melbourne, Australia.Described in Gong et al. (2003; doi:10.1038/nature02033).

name: PV-Cre (unknown background) x B6.Cg-Gt(ROSA)26Sor<tm9(CAG-tdTomato)Hze>/J
description: Offspring from mice expressing Cre recombinase directed to parvalbumin-expressing cells bred with mice containing loxP-flanked sequences. This offspring has parvalbumin postive interneurons that express the fluorescent protein tdTomato.

name: BXD65x B6.Cg-Tg(APPSwFlLon,PSEN1*M146L*L286V)6799Vas/Mmjax
description: Transgenic mice that retained the transgenes from the 5XFAD parent following the cross of 5XFAD strain and BXD65 strain, and thus display Alzheimer’s disease-like pathology

name: BXD68 x B6.Cg-Tg(APPSwFlLon,PSEN1*M146L*L286V)6799Vas/Mmjax
description: Transgenic mice that retained the transgenes from the 5XFAD parent following the cross of 5XFAD strain and BXD68 strain, and thus display Alzheimer’s disease-like pathology

name: HAZ (AB background)
description: A zebrafish line that was bred by selectively mating animals displaying high mirror aggression behavior for four generations, each generation selecting the most aggressive animals to produce the next generation offspring.

name: Tg-L7-GFP (unknown background)
description: A transgenic mouse strain expressing GFP in Purkinje cells.

name: BXD66x B6.Cg-Tg(APPSwFlLon,PSEN1*M146L*L286V)6799Vas/Mmjax (WT)
description: Mice that lost the transgenes from the 5XFAD parent following the cross of 5XFAD strain and BXD66 strain, and thus display wild-type traits.

name: Tg-scFv-NLG2-645-EGFP (C57BL/6J background)
description: A transgenic strain produced by transfection with lentivirus driving the expression of the single chain Fv fragments (scFv) intrabody against the cytoplasmic domain of NLG2 (scFvNLG2-645) in combination with enhanced green fluorescent protein (EGFP).

name: vGAT-iRES-Cre (Bl6Fx background)
description: A strain with Cre recombinase expression directed to inhibitory GABAergic neuron cell bodies, without disrupting endogenous vesicular inhibitory amino acid transporter expression.

name: Cyclin D2 KO (C57BL/6J background)
description:
A strain where cyclin D2, a FSH-responsive gene involved in gonadal cell proliferation and oncogenesis, has been knocked out. Cyclin D2 KO mice are backcrossed into the C57BL/6J background for more than six generations.They have been shown to be almost completely devoid of adult hippocampal neurogenesis. 
Described in Sicinski et al. (1996; doi:10.1038/384470a0).

name: SWR
description: SWR' is the strain family name.

name: Tg(Rbp4-cre)KL100Gsat
description: Rbp4-Cre mice express Cre recombinase in retinol binding protein 4 (Rbp4)-expressing neurons of cortical layer 5 and will express GCaMP6f when the viral construct is recombined.

name: BXD32 x B6.Cg-Tg(APPSwFlLon,PSEN1*M146L*L286V)6799Vas/Mmjax
description: Transgenic mice that retained the transgenes from the 5XFAD parent following the cross of 5XFAD strain and BXD32 strain, and thus display Alzheimer’s disease-like pathology

name: BXD44 x B6.Cg-Tg(APPSwFlLon,PSEN1*M146L*L286V)6799Vas/Mmjax (WT)
description: Mice that lost the transgenes from the 5XFAD parent following the cross of 5XFAD strain and BXD44 strain, and thus display wild-type traits.

name: B6.129P2-Pvalb<tm1(cre)Arbr>/J x B6.Cg-Gt(ROSA)26Sor<tm9(CAG-tdTomato)Hze>/J
description: Offspring from mice expressing Cre recombinase directed to parvalbumin-expressing cells bred with mice containing loxP-flanked sequences. This offspring has parvalbumin postive interneurons that express the fluorescent protein tdTomato.

name: B6.Cg-Pvalb<tm1.1(cre)Aibs>/J × B6.Cg-Gt(ROSA)26Sor<tm9(CAG-tdTomato)Hze>/J
description: Offspring from mice expressing Cre recombinase directed to parvalbumin-expressing cells bred with mice containing loxP-flanked sequences. This offspring has parvalbumin postive interneurons that express the fluorescent protein tdTomato.

name: B6/129S/SvEv
description: A hybrid strain (F1 or F2) by crossing C57BL/6 mice and 129S/SvEv mice.

name: BXD62x B6.Cg-Tg(APPSwFlLon,PSEN1*M146L*L286V)6799Vas/Mmjax
description: Transgenic mice that retained the transgenes from the 5XFAD parent following the cross of 5XFAD strain and BXD62 strain, and thus display Alzheimer’s disease-like pathology

name: Tg-scFv-gephcyto-EGFP (C57BL/6J background)
description: A transgenic strain produced by transfection with lentivirus driving the expression of the single chain Fv fragments (scFv)  intrabody against aminoacids 153-348 of gephyrin protein (scFv-geph) which binds  gephyrin at its normal subcellular location in combination with enhanced green fluorescent protein (EGFP).

name: B6.FVB(Cg)-Tg(Drd1-cre)EY262Gsat/Mmucd x B6.Cg-Gt(ROSA)26Sor<tm9(CAG-tdTomato)Hze>/J
description: Offspring from mice expressing Cre recombinase directed to dopamine receptor 1a-expressing cells bred with mice containing loxP-flanked sequences. This offspring has dopamine receptor 1a postive cells that express the fluorescent protein tdTomato.

name: Tg(Pdgfrb-EGFP)JN169Gsat
description: Pdgfrb-EGFP mice were originally generated at the Gene Expression Nervous System Atlas (GENSAT) program at the Rockefeller University, New York,USA.  An EGFP reporter gene, followed by a polyadenylation sequence, was inserted into BAC clone RP23-10L16 at the initiating ATG codon of the first coding exon of the Pdgfrb gene so that EGFP expression is driven by the regulatory sequences of the BAC gene. The resulting modified BAC (BX1944) was used to generate this transgene. This transgenic mouse strain expresses EGFP in cells expressing platelet-derived growth factor receptor beta (PDGRFRB or PDGRFRbeta).

name: IB2 KO (129/Sv background)
description: A strain where IB2, Islet-Brain-2 gene, has been knocked out.

name: Tg-ArcSwe (unknown background)
description: A transgenic mouse model carrying human Amyloid beta precursor protein (AbetaPP) cDNA with the Arctic (p. E693G) and Swedish (p. KM670/671NL) mutations.

name: Wistar-TgN(CAG-GFP)184ys
description: A transgenic rat strain that expresses enhanced green fluorescent protein (EGFP). Also described in Hakamata et al. (2001; doi:10.1006/bbrc.2001.545).

name: BXD69x B6.Cg-Tg(APPSwFlLon,PSEN1*M146L*L286V)6799Vas/Mmjax
description: Transgenic mice that retained the transgenes from the 5XFAD parent following the cross of 5XFAD strain and BXD69 strain, and thus display Alzheimer’s disease-like pathology

name: B6.Cg-Tg(Camk2a-tTA)1Mmay/DboJ x Luc-tetO-lacZ (unknown background)
description:
Hybrid generated by crossing Camk2a promoter line with responder line transgenic for bidirectional reporter gene construct containing E.coli derived LacZ reporter gene encoding beta-galactosidase and Luciferase gene from Photinus pyralis (Lus-tetO-lacZ).
Described in Lillehaug et al. (2019; doi:10.1038/sdata.2019.28).

name: Tg-scFv-geph-NLS-EGFP (Wistar background)
description: A transgenic strain produced by calcium phosphate transfection with single chain Fv fragments (scFv) intrabody against aminoacids 153-348 of gephyrin protein (scFv-geph) fused with a nuclear localization signal (scFv-geph NLS) in combination with enhanced green fluorescent protein (EGFP).

name: SST-Cre (C57BL/6J background) x B6.Cg-Gt(ROSA)26Sor<tm9(CAG-tdTomato)Hze>/J
description: Offspring from mice expressing Cre recombinase directed to somatostatin-expressing cells bred with mice containing loxP-flanked sequences. This offspring has somatostatin postive interneurons that express the fluorescent protein tdTomato.

name: PV-Cre (C57BL/6J background)
description: Mice with this strain express Cre recombinase directed to parvalbumin-expressing cells.

name: B6;C3-Tg(Scnn1a-cre)3Aibs/J
description:
These Scnn1a-Tg3-Cre mice express Cre recombinase under the control of the Scnn1a (sodium channel, nonvoltage-gated 1 alpha) promoter/enhancer regions, and may be useful for generating conditional mutations for studying gain or loss of function and/or fate mapping in subgroups of brain tissues (including cortex, thalamus, midbrain, and cerebellum).
Following injection of a modified BAC carrying the mutation into embryos from B6C3 mice, transgenic males were bred to C57BL/6J females. In total, backcrossed to C57BL/6J for four or more generations.

name: B6.Cg-Gt(ROSA)26Sor<tm27.1(CAG-COP4*H134R/tdTomato)Hze>/J
description: Ai27D mice express an improved channelrhodopsin-2/tdTomato fusion protein following exposure to Cre recombinase. These mice can be used in optogenetic studies for rapid in vivo activation of excitable cells by illumination with blue light (450-490 nm).

name: B6;129S6-Chat<tm2(cre)Lowl>/J x B6.Cg-Gt(ROSA)26Sor<tm9(CAG-tdTomato)Hze>/J
description: Offspring from mice expressing Cre recombinase directed to ChAT-expressing cells bred with mice containing loxP-flanked sequences. This offspring has ChAT postive cells that express the fluorescent protein tdTomato.

name: B6.Cg-Tg(Camk2a-tTA)1Mmay/DboJ
description:
When these Camk2a-tTA transgenic mice are mated to strain carrying a gene of interest under the regulatory control of a tetracycline-responsive promoter element (TRE; tetO), expression of the target gene can be blocked by administration of the tetracycline analog, doxycycline. These mice are a "Tet-Off" tool that allow the inducible expression of genes in forebrain neurons, and may be useful in studying brain disorders such as Alzheimer's, Parkinson's disease, or other neurodegenerative diseases.

The CaMK2a-tTA transgene integrated into chromosome 12 causing a 508 Kb deletion that spans the 3' half of Vipr2, the entire Wdr60, Esyt2, D430020J02Rik and Ncapg2 loci and the first two exons of Ptprn2. Homozygous mice will therefore have a functional knock-out of the deleted loci, and altered or null expression of Vipr2 and Ptprn2.

name: BXD61x B6.Cg-Tg(APPSwFlLon,PSEN1*M146L*L286V)6799Vas/Mmjax
description: Transgenic mice that retained the transgenes from the 5XFAD parent following the cross of 5XFAD strain and BXD61 strain, and thus display Alzheimer’s disease-like pathology

name: LAZ (AB background)
description: A zebrafish line that was bred by selectively mating animals displaying low mirror aggression behavior for four generations, each generation selecting the least aggressive animals to produce the following offspring.

name: ATJ/FVB.129P2-FMR1-mix
description: A knockout strain carrying disruptions in the Fmr1 gene and resembles the neuropathology of the Fragile X Syndrome (FXS).

name: BAC-vGluT3/iCre (Bl6Fx background)
description: A strain with optimized Cre recombinase (iCre) with mutations within the BAC transgene. VGLUT3 is a vesicular glutamate transporter that mediates synaptic transmission by transporting the neurotransmitter, glutamate, into secretory vesicles. iCre-mediated recombination results in deletion of the flanked sequence in VGLUT3 positive cells.

name: Tg-Arc-dVenus (unknown background)
description: A transgenic mouse strain expressing the fluorescent protein dVenus in cells expressing the immediate early gene Arc.

name: APPPS1
description:
A transgenic mouse model on a C57BL/6J genetic background that coexpresses KM670/671NL mutated amyloid precursor protein and L166P mutated presenilin 1 under the control of a neuron-specific Thy1 promoter element (APPPS1 mice).
Described in Radde et al. (2006; doi:10.1038/sj.embor.7400784).

name: Tg-Thy1-GFP-M (C57BL/6J background)
description: A transgenic mouse strain expressing GFP in Thy1-expressing cells.

name: Tg-CCK (C57BL/6J background)
description: A transgenic mouse strain expressing cell-type-specific fluorescent markers to target specific connections, here cholecystokinin-expressing cells.

name: B6;129P2-Pvalb<tm1(cre)Arbr>/J x B6.Cg-Gt(ROSA)26Sor<tm3(CAG-EYFP)Hze>/J
description: Offspring from mice expressing Cre recombinase directed to parvalbumin-expressing cells bred with mice containing loxP-flanked sequences. This offspring has parvalbumin postive interneurons that express the fluorescent protein enhanced yellow fluorescent protein (EYFG).

name: Nr2f1<fl/fl>:Emx1-Cre x Thy1-eYFP-H (C57BL/6J background)
description: An additional cross of a knockout strain with inactivated Nr2f1/COUP-TFI expression (exclusively in cortical progenitors and their progeny) to also expresses eYFP specifically in layer V cortical neurons.

name: BXD75x B6.Cg-Tg(APPSwFlLon,PSEN1*M146L*L286V)6799Vas/Mmjax
description: Transgenic mice that retained the transgenes from the 5XFAD parent following the cross of 5XFAD strain and BXD75 strain, and thus display Alzheimer’s disease-like pathology

name: Prnp-tTA (unknown background) x Luc-tetO-lacZ (unknown background)
description:
Hybrid generated by crossing Prnp promoter line Prnp-tTA, line F959) with responder line transgenic for bidirectional reporter gene construct containing E.coli derived LacZ reporter gene encoding beta-galactosidase and Luciferase gene from Photinus pyralis (Lus-tetO-lacZ).
Described in Lillehaug et al. (2019; doi:10.1038/sdata.2019.28).

name: C57BL/6
description: 'C57BL/6' is the strain family name.

name: B6.129-Nlgn3<tm4Sud>/J
description: The strain constitutively expresses an X-linked mutant of Nlgn3 (neuroligin 3) carrying the equivalent Nlgn1 (neuroligin 1) gene mutations that have been identified to inhibit binding to alpha and beta neurexins. LoxP sites enable conditional knockout of Nlgn3 through cre-mediated excision. The strain has been backcrossed to C57BL/6 for 5 generations.

name: Nr2f1/COUP-TFI (C57BL/6J background) x Nex-Cre (C57BL/6J background)
description: A conditional knockout strain that was crossed with a Nex-1 Cre recombinase strain to abolish Nr2f1/COUP-TFI expression from postmitotic neurons. Described in Alfano et al. (2014; doi: 10.1038/ncomms6632).

name: PV-Cre (unknown background)
description: Mice with this strain express Cre recombinase directed to parvalbumin-expressing cells.

name: Nxnl2R (C57BL/6N background)
description:
The nucleoredoxin-like 2 (Nxnl2) gene reporter stain (Nxnl2R) was created using Velocigene stem cells.
Those cells carry a beta-galactosidase reporter knock-in in the Nxnl2 locus replacing the coding sequence
of the gene for the two proteins, rod-derived cone viability factor (RdCVF2) and the thioredoxin like
protein RdCVF2L. They were bred on a C57BL/6N background.

name: PV-Cre (C57BL/6J background) x B6.Cg-Gt(ROSA)26Sor<tm9(CAG-tdTomato)Hze>/J
description: Offspring from mice expressing Cre recombinase directed to parvalbumin-expressing cells bred with mice containing loxP-flanked sequences. This offspring has parvalbumin postive interneurons that express the fluorescent protein tdTomato.

name: B6.129(Cg)-Fos<tm1.1(cre/ERT2)Luo>/J × B6.Cg-Gt(ROSA)26Sor<tm9(CAG-tdTomato)Hze>/J
description:
A strain for targeted recombination in active populations (TRAP), to obtain genetic access to neurons that were activated by defined stimuli. This method utilizes mice in which the tamoxifen-dependent recombinase CreER(T2) is expressed in an activity-dependent manner from the loci of the immediate early genes Arc and Fos. Active cells that express CreER(T2) can only undergo recombination when tamoxifen is present, allowing genetic access to neurons that are active during a time window of less than 12 hr.
Described in Guenthner et al. (2013; doi:10.1016/j.neuron.2013.03.025).

name: VIP-Cre (unknown background)
description: Mice with this strain express Cre recombinase directed to vasoactive intestinal polypeptide-expressing cells.

name: VIP-Cre (C57BL/6J background)
description: Mice with this strain express Cre recombinase directed to vasoactive intestinal polypeptide-expressing cells.

name: Tg-scFv-geph-NLSC-EGFP (C57BL/6J background)
description: A transgenic strain produced by transfection with lentivirus driving the expression of the single chain Fv fragments (scFv) intrabody against aminoacids 153-348 of gephyrin protein (scFv-geph) fused with a specific nuclear localization signal (scFv-geph NLSC) in combination with enhanced green fluorescent protein (EGFP).

name: Nr2f1<fl/fl>:Nex-Cre x Thy1-eYFP-H (C57BL/6J background)
description: An additional cross of a knockout strain with abolished Nr2f1/COUP-TFI expression from postmitotic neurons to also expresses eYFP specifically in layer V cortical neurons.

name: C57BL/6J-Tg(Thy1-GCaMP6f)GP5.17Dkim/J
description:
These transgenic mice, made by the Genetically-Encoded Neuronal Indicator and Effector (GENIE) Project, express the green fluorescent calcium indicator, GCaMP6f, in subsets of excitatory neurons in the brain and possibly other cell types and tissues. The GCaMP6f indicator is an ultrasensitive detector of single neuronal action potentials and has fast response kinetics.
The transgene contains a mouse Thy1 promoter, GCaMP6f, woodchuck hepatitis virus posttranscriptional regulatory element (WPRE), and bovine growth hormone (bGH) polyadenylation sequence.

name: Tg-PSD95-EGFP (unknown background)
description: A transgenic mouse strain expressing EGFP in PSD95-expressing cells.

name: BXD77x B6.Cg-Tg(APPSwFlLon,PSEN1*M146L*L286V)6799Vas/Mmjax
description: Transgenic mice that retained the transgenes from the 5XFAD parent following the cross of 5XFAD strain and BXD77 strain, and thus display Alzheimer’s disease-like pathology

name: BXD51 x B6.Cg-Tg(APPSwFlLon,PSEN1*M146L*L286V)6799Vas/Mmjax
description: Transgenic mice that retained the transgenes from the 5XFAD parent following the cross of 5XFAD strain and BXD51 strain, and thus display Alzheimer’s disease-like pathology

name: Nr2f1/COUP-TFI (C57BL/6J background) x Thy1-eYFP-H (C57BL/6J background)
description: A conditional knockout ready strain for Nr2f1/COUP-TFI that was crossed to also expresses eYFP specifically in layer V cortical neurons.

name: B6;CBA-Tg(Cyp19a1-cre)1Dlc/J
description: Cyp19a1-Cre BAC transgenic mice express cre recombinase from the mouse Cyp19a1 (aromatase) promoter, faithfully recapitulating brain expression patterns of the endogenous mouse gene.

name: BXD66x B6.Cg-Tg(APPSwFlLon,PSEN1*M146L*L286V)6799Vas/Mmjax
description: Transgenic mice that retained the transgenes from the 5XFAD parent following the cross of 5XFAD strain and BXD66 strain, and thus display Alzheimer’s disease-like pathology

name: Nr2f1/COUP-TFI (C57BL/6J background)
description: A conditional knockout ready strain that, when crossed with a Cre recombinase expressing line, presents with an inactivation of Nr2f1/COUP-TFI (Nuclear Receptor subfamily 2, group F, member 1/ COUP Transcription Factor 1).

name: Tg-GAD67-EGPF (C57BL/6 background)
description: GAD67-EGPF transgenic mice, which express green fluorescence protein in GABAergic interneurons

name: B6;SJL-Tg(APPSWE)2576Kha
description: The Tg2576 model is one of the most well characterized, and widely used, mouse models of Alzheimer's disease. It overexpresses a mutant form of APP (isoform 695) with the Swedish mutation (KM670/671NL), resulting in elevated levels of Aβ and ultimately amyloid plaques.

name: B6;CBA-Tg(Cyp19a1-cre)1Dlc/J x B6.Cg-Gt(ROSA)26Sortm9(CAG-tdTomato)Hze/J
description: Offspring from mice expressing Cre recombinase directed to aromatase-expressing cells bred with mice containing loxP-flanked sequences. This offspring has aromatase postive neurons that express the fluorescent protein tdTomato.

name: Tg-Cx3cr1-GFP (C57BL/6J background)
description: A transgenic mouse strain expressing GFP in microglia cells.

name: Tg-EGFP (C57BL/6J background)
description: A transgenic strain produced by transfection with lentivirus driving the expression of enhanced green fluorescent protein (EGFP).

name: Tg-EGFP (Wistar background)
description: A transgenic strain produced by calcium phosphate transfection with enhanced green fluorescent protein (EGFP).

name: SST-Cre (unknown background)
description: Mice with this strain express Cre recombinase directed to somatostatin-expressing cells.

name: B6;129-Tg(Drd1-cre)120Mxu/Mmjax
description: These mice express Cre recombinase under the control of the mouse Drd1a (dopamine receptor D1A) promoter. DRD1A is s a G-protein coupled receptor involved in the regulation of neuronal growth and development. The D1 subtype is the most abundant dopamine receptor in the central nervous system. Defects in dopaminergic neurons are associated with Parkinson's disease, schizophrenia, attention-deficit and hyperactivity disorder, and compulsive drug abuse.

name: Tg-Drd1a-EGFP (Arc:Arc(S) background)
description: Drd1a-EGFP mice were originally generated at the Gene Expression Nervous System Atlas (GENSAT) program at the Rockefeller University, New York,USA, and were bred on an outbred Arc:Arc(S) Swiss background at the Florey Institute of Neuroscienceand Mental Health, Melbourne, Australia.Described in Gong et al. (2003; doi:10.1038/nature02033).

name: BXD87x B6.Cg-Tg(APPSwFlLon,PSEN1*M146L*L286V)6799Vas/Mmjax
description: Transgenic mice that retained the transgenes from the 5XFAD parent following the cross of 5XFAD strain and BXD87 strain, and thus display Alzheimer’s disease-like pathology

name: B6/SJL
description: A hybrid strain (F1 or F2) by crossing C57BL/6 mice and SJL mice.

name: BXD60x B6.Cg-Tg(APPSwFlLon,PSEN1*M146L*L286V)6799Vas/Mmjax
description: Transgenic mice that retained the transgenes from the 5XFAD parent following the cross of 5XFAD strain and BXD60 strain, and thus display Alzheimer’s disease-like pathology

name: Tg(Grik4-cre)G35-3Stl x B6.Cg-Igs7tm148.1(tetO-GCaMP6f,CAG-tTA2)Hze/J
description: Offspring of G35-3 mice, expressing cre recombinase and cre-dependent Ai148D mice. Cre and GCaMP6f expresses especially in cortical pyramidal cells, layer 2/3.
